index.html:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8" />
    <title>Webfoundry</title>
    <meta
      name="viewport"
      content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, maximum-scale=1"
    />
  </head>
  <body class="min-h-screen">
    <script type="module">
      (async () => {
        window.rootPrefix = /^\/(files|preview)\//.test(location.pathname) ? location.pathname.split('/').slice(0, 4).join('/') : '/';
        if (rootPrefix === '/' || rootPrefix === '/collab.html') rootPrefix = '.';
        if (new URL(location.href).searchParams.get('isolate') != null) {
          await navigator.serviceWorker.register('/sw.js');
          await navigator.serviceWorker.ready;
          if (!navigator.serviceWorker.controller) return location.reload();
          let wforigin = `${location.protocol}//${location.hostname.split('.').slice(1).join('.')}`;
          let parts = location.pathname.slice(1).split('/');
          let tabId = parts[1];
          navigator.serviceWorker.addEventListener('message', async event => {
            let { type, project, path } = event.data || {};
            if (type !== 'fetch') return;
            let port = event.ports?.[0];
            if (!port) return;
            let handler = ev => {
              let data = ev.data || {};
              if (data.type !== 'fetch:res' || data.project !== project || data.path !== path) return;
              removeEventListener('message', handler);
              port.postMessage(data);
            };
            addEventListener('message', handler);
            parent.postMessage({ type: 'fetch', project, path }, wforigin);
          });
          let register = () => navigator.serviceWorker.controller.postMessage({ type:'webfoundry-register-tab', tabId });
          navigator.serviceWorker.addEventListener('controllerchange', register);
          register();
          if (!location.pathname.startsWith('/preview/')) {
            let project = parts[2];
            let path = parts.slice(3).join('/');
            if (path !== 'index.html') {
              let handler = async ev => {
                let data = ev.data || {};
                if (data.type !== 'fetch:res' || data.project !== project || data.path !== path) return;
                removeEventListener('message', handler);
                document.open();
                document.write(await data.data.text());
                document.close();
              };
              addEventListener('message', handler);
              parent.postMessage({ type: 'fetch', project, path }, wforigin);
              return;
            }
          }
          await new Promise(pres => setTimeout(pres, 100));
        }
        if (location.pathname.includes('/files/')) return;
        let [, md, mapp] = await Promise.all([
          import(`${rootPrefix}/webfoundry/head.js`),
          import(`${rootPrefix}/webfoundry/dominant.js`),
          import(`${rootPrefix}/webfoundry/app.js`),
        ]);
        document.body.append(md.default.el(mapp.default));
        parent.postMessage(
          { path: `pages/${location.pathname.slice(1).split('/').slice(3).join('/')}`, type: 'ready', status: 200 },
          new URL(location.href).searchParams.get('isolate') != null ? `${location.protocol}//${location.hostname.split('.').slice(1).join('.')}` : location.origin,
        );
      })();
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

pages/vessel.html:
Vessel Software

One developer, two custom frameworks, production-grade results.

I built Dominant and Webfoundry after React handcoding slowed my clients down. Now I ship full sites and apps about 10x faster, with cleaner code and lower delivery cost than a traditional agency.

Watch the Dominant demo Preview Webfoundry builds

How I deliver

Work directly with the engineer who built the tooling. I own discovery, implementation, and iteration without the overhead of agency layers or handoffs.

Custom stack advantage

Dominant and Webfoundry exist because React handcoding was a bottleneck. You get architecture that fits your product instead of conforming to a generic framework.

10x delivery speed

Visual building plus code-level control takes ideas to production in a fraction of the time it takes to handcraft React screens.

Embedded partnership

I plug into your roadmap, keep feedback loops tight, and use live editing sessions so stakeholders always see real progress.

Lean budget impact

A solo delivery model with proprietary tooling means agency polish at a fraction of the cost, no surprise staffing fees.

Dominant

Dominant: my lean engine for complex interfaces

I wrote Dominant because React's abstractions slowed client work to a crawl. Mutable state, direct DOM bindings, and a single update call keep performance tight and the codebase easy to reason about.

  • - Mutate plain objects and call `d.update()` when you want the DOM to react.
  • - Blend with any DOM API, vanilla JS widget, or legacy surface.
  • - Battle-tested on dashboards, marketing sites, and heavy animation demos.
Webfoundry

Webfoundry: 10x faster sites and apps

Webfoundry is my visual builder layered on Dominant. I iterate with clients in the canvas, wire state through controllers, and push production-ready deploys in days, not months.

  • - Visual Tailwind canvas backed by real JavaScript controllers.
  • - `wf-` bindings keep copy, data, and actions in sync as we iterate.
  • - Netlify-ready builds with code quality that holds up long after launch.

I help founders and product teams ship polished software at a fraction of traditional agency cost. Bring an idea or a backlog and I will move it into production quickly.

Discovery Design Build Coach

Reach me directly at hello@vessel.software and let's scope your build.

pages/playground.html:
Welcome editors

Use the toolbar or keybindings (see below) to remix this hero section

Select the headline and try swapping text colors from the Tailwind toolbar above or the styles panel (pencil icon on the sidebar change e.g. `text-white` `text-yellow-100`), experiment with different gradients, and add a Google Font also from the Tailwind toolbar or styles panel (e.g. add `gfont-[Poppins]`).

Change the background colors by editing the gradient utilities on this section element.
Tweak font sizes (`text-4xl`, `md:text-5xl`) and weights to feel how Tailwind classes update instantly.

Tailwind utility playground

Select the instruction cards in this column and try stacking utilities:

Swap `rounded-3xl` for sharper corners or add `ring-2` to outline the card.
Change `p-8` to `p-6` or `p-10` and pair it with responsive padding classes like `md:p-12`.
Apply `gfont-[Playfair_Display]` and adjust `tracking-[0.3em]` to customize typography.
Insert `hover:-translate-y-1` and `transition` utilities to demo interactive states.

Keybindings quick reference

Prefer the keyboard? These shortcuts mirror the ones available in the main app and `/collab.html`:

Ctrl + z
Undo the last change.
Ctrl + y
Redo in shared history.
h / j / k / l
Move selection to parent, next, previous, or child element (also works with arrow keys).
Escape
Clear the current selection, then press again to restore it.
t
Change text content of selected element.
c
Copy the focused element(s).
p / P / o / O
Paste copied elements around or inside current selection.

Image Grid

Select images below and swap them with your own uploads using the Manipulation toolbar Text & Media Media Gallery or by pressing 'S' (uppercase for uploads, lowercase for custom URLs):

Hello, Webfoundry!

This card is wired to `controllers/Playground.js`. Update the input to see bindings in action, then launch some celebratory confetti.

Greeting output
{{state.playground.greeting}}

Tasklist Demo

Add lightweight tasks to track what you still want to tweak. These states live only in preview, so collaborators can create their own lists without collisions.
pages/onepager.html:
Webfoundry Next Generation Creative Web Building

Vision

Webfoundry exists to make creating for the web feel like playing again. Were building a 10 productivity platform for developers and designers who want to move faster, collaborate better, and build beautiful, performant web apps visually, yet with full code transparency and control.

Where tools like Figma stop at design and VS Code stops at code, Webfoundry unifies design, logic, shell integration, and live deployment into a single collaborative canvas. Its the missing link between creativity and execution.

What It Does

Webfoundry is a real-time, browser-based web IDE with an intelligent visual editor powered by Tailwind CSS, a Trystero WebRTC mesh, and a NodeJS Companion server to connect it to the file system and shell.

Creators can:

  • Design responsive UIs visually (with Tailwind semantics preserved).

  • Edit live project code in sync with teammates (full HTML, JS, CSS fidelity).

  • Run and deploy instantly to Netlify or export to ZIP, desktop (Tauri), or Android (APK).

Its like if VS Code, Figma, and Replit had a child one that speaks in Tailwind, syncs over Trystero, and treats data-first editing as a native concept.

The Wedge

While the no-code movement chased simplicity, Webfoundrys wedge is power-users first: builders who know code but crave speed, coherence, and delight.

Were not dumbing creation down were amplifying expert flow through intelligent design systems, live context sharing, and multiplayer-aware architecture.

Webfoundry starts with true fans: indie developers, studios, and open-source tinkerers who want a unified playground for shipping modern web experiences faster than ever before.

The Architecture Advantage

  • Controllers: Modular singleton classes exposing state and actions through a global API.

  • Realtime Backbone: Trystero mesh + Companion server handle sync, diffs, and cross-tab collaboration.

  • Offline-first: LocalForage file system and optional local shell integration with fetch interception make it fully serverless with the exception of Trystero for live collaboration.

  • Service Worker Controlled: Smart caching and request rewriting for per-tab session routing.

This is not a toy or a static site builder its a foundry for everything from prototypes to production apps.

Market & Momentum

The $15B web development tools market is ripe for convergence. Developers are frustrated by disconnected pipelines (design code deploy). Webfoundry collapses that gap.

Our early alpha shows developers building real apps in hours instead of days, with synced live previews and zero setup. The enthusiasm from our early community confirms: this is the IDE weve all wanted but never had.

The Ask

Were currently aligning early partners and seed investors to accelerate:

  • Product polish and team expansion (2 core engineers, 1 marketing lead).

  • Early alpha rollout to select creators and indie studios.

  • Preparation for accelerator programs (YC / Antler).

Were not just building a tool. Were building the creative operating system for the modern web.

webfoundry56.netlify.app

Contact: gui@guiprav.com
Founder: Gui Pr Product engineer, creative technologist, and believer that building should feel like magic.
